pr_title: Fix linkage errors, qualifier handling, NPE in metrics processing, and revert Xerces upgrade

timeline.message:
Fix linkage errors

Endorses ServiceMix saaj-api and activation-api bundles and exports
their packages from bundle 0. This fixes an issue in Karaf causing
linkage errors.
Change qualifier handling to respect use cases other than derived resources

Revert "DDF-6075 Dependency Upgrades [2.21.x] (#6098)"

This reverts commit cbb8be60c8223f814d84a4e48af3c4f50630ccca.
Check for empty collection to avoid NoSuchElementException from Iterator.next()

timeline.author: SmithJosh

timeline.bodyText: Can we update unit tests to check this?
timeline.author: clockard

replies.bodyText: Added a unit test for this
replies.author: SmithJosh

timeline.author: clockard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -429,8 +430,17 @@ private static URI getResourceOrDerivedUri(ResourceInfo resourceInfo, ResourceRe
     // check if the resource request included a qualifier in which case we are trying to retrieve
     // a derived resource and not the resource
     final Serializable qualifier = resourceReq.getPropertyValue(ResourceRequest.QUALIFIER);
-
-    if (qualifier == null) { // no qualifier means we are retrieving the resource
+    final String scheme = resourceInfo.getResourceUri().getScheme();
+
+    // no qualifier means we are retrieving the resource
+    // presence of a qualifier can mean different things. We interpret it based on protocol:
+    //   - content: this always means we are retrieving a derived resource.
+    //   - http(s): we assume the intent is to retrieve a derived resource. Is this always true?
+    //   - other: we assume we are retrieving the resource. This assumption is based on experience
+    //            with protocols that use the qualifier for purposes other than derived resources.
+    //            If protocols besides content and http(s) need to support derived resources, this
+    //            could be an issue.
+    if (qualifier == null || !Arrays.asList("http", "https", "content").contains(scheme)) {

replies.bodyText: Hm... same here. No unit tests for this derived resource handling logic. I can try to add something for this change, but the whole method needs tests.
replies.author: SmithJosh
